body.name: VIZIO D65u-D2 65" Class UHD Full-Array LED Smart TV (Black)
body.stockDetail: Only 3 left in stock - order soon.
features: 1. Ultra HD w/ Spatial Scaling Engine
2. Full-Array LED Backlight w/ 16 Active LED Zones
3. Clear Action 240 w/ 120Hz Effective Refresh Rate
4. Smart TV w/ Ultra HD streaming support
5. Dual band 802.11ac - up to 3x faster Wi-Fi¹
body.description: Product Description Introducing the all-new VIZIO D-Series Ultra HD Full-Array LED Smart TV. With over 8.3 million pixels in every image, four times the resolution of 1080p Full HD, D-Series Ultra HD displays produce breathtaking detail and clarity. Full-Array LED backlighting and 16 Active LED Zones deliver superior light uniformity with an extremely high contrast, and deep, pure black levels. Active Pixel Tuning enables pixel-level brightness adjustments for increased picture accuracy and contrast. And with Clear Action 240, sports and action fans will appreciate the powerful image processing of the D-Series with a blazing 120Hz effective refresh rate enhanced with backlight scanning for sharper detail in fast action scenes. In addition, the beautifully designed D-Series is optimized to deliver all of your favorite entertainment in stunning 4k Ultra HD right out of the box. Thanks to HEVC decoding and ultra-fast 802.11ac dual-band Wi-Fi (up to 3x faster ), you’ll get Ultra HD streaming from popular apps like Netflix, Instant Video and UltraFlix. Its powerful Spatial Scaling Engine beautifully transforms your favorite 720p and 1080p HD sports, movies, and TV shows into near Ultra HD. And support for the latest HDMI standards enables Ultra HD playback from next generation cable and satellite receivers, Blu-ray players and game consoles. It all adds up to a beautifully simple experience where the picture is everything and nothing is more captivating! Source: IEEE standard 802.11 specifications. Maximum throughput rate of 802.11ac (1300 Mbps) is approximately three times faster than that of 802.11n (450 Mbps). Actual rate will vary, and will be subject to router model, site environment, range, Internet bandwidth and other factors. High-speed/Broadband Internet service and access equipment are required and not provided by VIZIO. Amazon.com

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Simply Stunning Incredible Picture Quality. Smarter TV. Amazing Value.

Incredible Picture. Unbeatable Value. 4K Ultra HD for all has arrived. VIZIO D-Series delivers incredible UHD picture quality and powerful performance, driven by an ultra-intuitive Smart TV experience that makes UHD streaming simple.

Picture Perfect Brilliance. Enjoy four times the resolution of Full HD for breathtaking clarity. Discover stunning detail and definition at twice the pixel height of 1080p. Experience 8.3 Million screen pixels in every image.
Stunning Performance. Contrast meets clarity. VIZIO D-Series features 16 Active LED Zones that intelligently adapt to the content on screen for a heightened contrast ratio of 5 Million-to-1.

A leading HDTV company in America* Simpler. Smarter. Smart TV. VIZIO Internet Apps Plus and Dual-Band Wi-Fi are built into every VIZIO D-Series UHD Smart TV. Enjoy a variety of popular apps with Ultra HD streaming content and Internet radio at your fingertips†. The simplified app home and app launcher make finding your favorite entertainment effortless. Easier to Navigate. A convenient seven-position App Launcher and Full-Screen App Home makes it simpler to discover new apps and find what you want. Automatic Updates. Apps automatically update to stay current with the latest improvements and upgrades for a more seamless experience. * The NPD Group/Retail Tracking Service, LCD TV with a display resolution of 1336 x 768 pixels or higher, January 2012 – July 2015. † High-speed/Broadband Internet service and access equipment are required and not provided by VIZIO. Additional fees and/ or subscriptions required for certain content and services. The applications and content of the VIZIO Internet Apps and VIZIO Internet Apps Plus pictured herein or described on this page may only be available in certain countries and languages, may require additional fees or subscription charges, and may be subject to future updates, modifications, interruption and/or discontinuation of service without notice. VIZIO has no control over third party application or content and assumes no responsibility for the availability or interruption of such application or content. Additional third-party terms, conditions and restrictions apply. High-speed/Broadband Internet service and access equipment are required and are not provided by VIZIO. Quicker & Smarter - A revamped user interface lets you access the apps you love quicker and more easily. Built-In Wi-Fi - Ultra-fast Wi-Fi provides an easy clutter-free Internet connection. Premium App Collection - A newly expanded apps library adds to an already unrivaled selection. Full-Screen App Launcher - A full-screen app launcher makes finding and organizing your apps a breeze.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2016
reviews.reviewText: Great TV with beautiful picture.Pros:Great app library.Works with DLNA servers right out of the box. (Seems to play most mkvs and mp4s, no avis)Has a Digital OTA TV Tuner (Something they are taking out of newer models)5 HDMI inputs (#3 can be used as an audio output if desired)Beautiful picture, though 4k sources are hard to come byCEC support (1 remote to rule them all...)Seems very fast in loading thingsConsSpeakers aren't amazing. I use a Sound BarInterface a little clunky, because there's no keyboard. Makes searching for content in Smart Apps annoying. Other similar vizio models have a remote with a keyboard on the backRemote doesn't have headphone support like my Roku

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great size, great picture, great bang for your buck.
reviews.reviewText: Image Quality:To start with, this TV is 4k, so obviously the image is going to be incredibly sharp and detailed. Having only recently switched to 4k, this was a major improvement!It’s also the largest TV I’ve owned, so the 65 inches were a nice bump for me, bringing out even more of the UHD details.This model also had lots of options for very precisely calibrating and fine-tuning the display specifically to your liking— great for AV geeks!Once you start spending $1000 or more, it would be nice to have the HDR technology included. This TV did not have that, but still had a very beautiful image.General Design:Design-wise, the TV looks great. Very thin, of course. The main challenge I had with this TV was that it had difficulty recognizing my universal remote’s commands. I have a programmable Harmony Universal remote that worked fine with 5 other TVs, but for some reason, when I attempted to switch inputs to use another device, the TV had difficulty switching; more often than not, it would fail to switch to the correct input. Very annoying!Smart Features:The smart apps were great, and make for an easy way to quickly test out your 4k immediately after set up. One annoyance: if you attempt to switch to another input from the SmartHub’s Netflix app, it won’t let you switch until you answer “Do you want to exit Netflix?” This ended up being a huge nuisance.Audio:I didn’t bother testing the speakers very much. I knew the audio quality for an affordable TV was not going to be amazing. My belief is that if you’re purchasing a large TV, you should have a decent sound system (I recommend a VIZIO sound bar), and not expect the TV to give you an amazing audio experience.PROs:- Excellent all-around image quality.- Very affordable for being 65”!- Decent SmartHub with Amazon, Netflix, etcCONS:- No HDR- Has difficulty responding to certain Universal Remote commandsBottom line: Great size, great image, great bang for your buck.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Great TV, avoid third party sellers.
reviews.reviewText: TV arrived damaged. Seller refused to replace it. Wanted to charge me for an older model.Aside from the damaged pixels, the image quality is spectacular.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2016
reviews.reviewText: White like ghost shadow in the screen. Is really pain to send this back!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I like everything about this tv
reviews.reviewText: I like everything about this tv. It has the specs I was shopping for and the refurb price is unbeatable. Looks like new to me. Five 4K hdmi inputs and optical audio out. 4K media is hard to find, but looks like a moving photograph. Beautiful display.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far, so good.
reviews.reviewText: So far so good. My model is refurbished but so far works perfectly. You can't beat the price, especially considering the quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Best TV I’ve Ever Bought
reviews.reviewText: I would give this TV five stars if it didn’t have issues every now and then with the SmartCast function. I’ve had to do he recommended IT trick of turning it off, unplugging it, holding the power button for 15 seconds, plugging it back in, and turning it on again about a dozen times since I bought it ten months ago. Other than that, I frickin love this TV!Not only was this on sale for $600 when I bought it, it’s worth at least $1000. Great picture quality, great features, and you get Pluto TV (WatchFree) already on the TV. I now watch the Fail Army channel when I can’t find anything on Netflix or Hulu.I also like that our guests can cast to the TV too. We used to have a ChromeCast (which has since died) and it would malfunction all the time. We now use our Vizio and Apple TV (for the older TV) and nothing else. I would definitely buy another Vizio when we need to replace the older TV.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2016
reviews.reviewText: Clear crisp picture. Using in conference room for presentations

reviews.reviewTitle: Add a streaming player and you get top notch picture quality AND functionality.
reviews.reviewText: Stunning picture quality. No issues with display at all, very pleased. Interface is a bit barebones, but don't forget this is a value brand.My only issue is it is not fully SMART tv as it only has a limited selection of available apps. In my case it was impossible to install ETV NET - something like Netflix but for Eastern europe.Was going to return it but found an easy brilliant solution - Roku streaming stick for $49.99 (this is a media streamer, Google it). Roku turned this TV into a very smart one. In fact, I would even doubt whether you need to pay premium for Smart Tv - just get a decent TV and spend $50 for a streaming stick - no smart TV can ever match it's functionality anyway.Another issue was with legs spacing - too wide for my existing stand (not Vizio or Amazon's fault). Solution was an aftermarket stand for $53. There are plenty of these universally compatible stands. It's the same concept as a wall mount plate, but instead of the mounting bracket it has legs to stand on.Good job VIZIO!

reviews.reviewTitle: TV is nice, but scrolling through smart options (apps) was a ...
reviews.reviewText: TV is nice, but scrolling through smart options (apps) was a bit slow and glitchy. Freezes a bit, have to exit and re-enter menus. Also, BEWARE of the legs on this TV. They have a wide span with the weight resting on the farthest most tips on each end of the legs. We have a curved/decorative fireplace mantle and unfortunately after centering the TV, the legs don't rest on the part of the mantle that bulges out so I had to add a temporary piece of wood for the TV to rest on. Would have preferred a center mount goose-neck stand. We'll keep the TV but now have to spring for a sturdy wall-mount stand. Picture quality seemed a bit dim and under-whelming, but that was solved when putting TV screen preset to "Vivid" mode. Much better for our lighting. Overall, besides the quarks mentioned I'd have give this 4-4.5 stars. For the price, good value. OH and remote is a bit sensitive and must be pointed at the right angle to catch the TV or it won't work.

reviews.reviewTitle: 65" 4K Computer Monitor blows away my 65" 1080P Samsung Monitor
reviews.reviewText: So I've been using this since black Friday 2016 as my main computer monitor.I couldn't be happier! It's simply amazing! I got this to replace my Samsung 1080P 65" monitor and the difference is night and day. This was also half the price! The whites are BRIGHT WHITE and the blacks are PITCH black - the Windows 10 black start bar for instance.. I can't tell where the screen's black bezel starts because it's the same shade of pitch black!Of course there are better tv's out there, the local dimming in this TV is excellent for only being 16 zones, but you would certainly want a much higher dimming zone count for those true movie buffs. As a computer monitor, I couldn't be happier!***Jan 31 2017Still performing incredibly well! There have been three times I've turned on the TV and it said, "Your firmware has been updated" and that was pretty cool and done through wifi I assume.The only issue I've had with the monitor in the 1200 hours of use so far was when I would enter PICTURE SETTINGS and change them I would get strange HDMI handshake signal loss issues, but that was resolved with the first firmware update that happened.This screen is just unbelieable as a computer monitor! As a TV it's COMPLETELY fine it's a bloody tv for crying outloud, most people don't sit close like I do for computer use. Using a 4K TV as a monitor presents an easy to fix issue in Windows as well, EVERYTHING IS TINY! So you just go to your desktop settings and slide the bar that says, "Change the size of text, apps, and other items: XXX%" to whatever you like and the text on webpages and the start menu and other programs all displays "normal" size but you still get that 4K clarity on everything else. The text on this screen looks as good as my LG G5 screen SO crisp!Enough of this though - GET THIS SCREEN if you are wondering if 4K is for you!

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't let the negatives outweight the the positives of this gorgeous TV!!!
reviews.reviewText: Just setup this 65" tv last night. It took a little while to get the color to where I wanted it, but when I did it was picture perfect. Hockey games looked buttery smooth and movies are a visual treat!!If you are looking for a big TV on a budget, look no further. Don't be swayed by some of these negative reviews you see on here, this is a great TV.... it's not a $4000 TV though, so it should not be compared to the likes of Samsung.The two biggest complaints about this TV are the audio and the viewing angles. Yes audio could be better, but can be quickly solved with a soundbar... and really it's not nearly as bad as some are making it out to be. I'm an audiophile and I don't find it bad at all. The viewing angles are fairly narrow.... but to put it into perspective, they aren't going to be any worse than the HDTV you bought 8 years ago.... I saw it side by side with a Sanyo and an LG and while the LG had much better angles, the Vizio topped the Sanyo. Small price to pay for this bang for buck TV.If you're in the market, you should consider this one. You won't be dissapointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a great TV, the quality of actual 4k stuff is ...
reviews.reviewText: This is a great TV, the quality of actual 4k stuff is fantastic. I will say that I have noticed that some older movies that were shot on film (in SD or HD quality) have a weird feel to, there's a sensation that character/camera movement in terms of speed just doesn't feel right. But as I haven't seen a lot of other 4k TV's I can't say if it's something specific to this one or if it's a problem with all 4k's.I will say that while I love having the Netflix button right there...there is naturally an issue that arises with having button to specific streaming services (instead of just making it programmable), it's that if they go out of business as it happens, the button becomes useless. Like the XUMO button that does the same thing as the Vizio logo button, and iHeart Radio button that brings up a message telling you that it's not available in Canada.Additionally it would be really nice if any of the two wireless keyboard/remote's (with dongles) I have would work because typing letter by letter with vizio's remote is a pain in the ass. But apparently it doesn't automatically detect them and I'm not sure if there's a way to install them.Anyways great TV
